title: Control Variate Sliced Wasserstein Estimators. (arXiv:2305.00402v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: The sliced Wasserstein (SW) distances between two probability measures are defined as the expectation of the Wasserstein distance between two one-dimensional projections of the two measures. The randomness comes from a projecting direction that is used to project the two input measures to one dimension. Due to the intractability of the expectation, Monte Carlo integration is performed to estimate the value of the SW distance. Despite having various variants, there has been no prior work that improves the Monte Carlo estimation scheme for the SW distance in terms of controlling its variance. To bridge the literature on variance reduction and the literature on the SW distance, we propose computationally efficient control variates to reduce the variance of the empirical estimation of the SW distance. The key idea is to first find Gaussian approximations of projected one-dimensional measures, then we utilize the closed-form of the Wasserstein-2 distance between two Gaussian distributions t

translated_abstract: 两个概率分布之间的切片Wasserstein距离被定义为这两个分布的一维投影的Wasserstein距离的期望。随机性来自于用于将两个输入分布投影到一维的投影方向。由于期望的不可计算性，蒙特卡罗积分被用来估计SW距离的值。尽管有各种各样的变体，但没有先前的工作在控制切片Wasserstein距离的方差方面改进了蒙特卡罗估计方案。为了连通方差降低和切片Wasserstein距离的相关文献，我们提出了计算效率高的控制变量，以减少SW距离的经验估计的方差。其核心思想是首先找到投影后的一维分布的高斯近似，然后利用两个高斯分布之间Wasserstein-2距离的封闭形式。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种使用高斯近似和控制变量的方法，以提高蒙特卡罗估计的切片Wasserstein距离的效率，并降低其方差。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a computationally efficient method using Gaussian approximation and control variates to improve the efficiency and reduce the variance of Monte Carlo estimation of sliced Wasserstein distances.
